greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the sum of the divisors d of n such that n/d is cubefree.
link: Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: Multiplicative with a(p) = 1 + p; a(p^e) = p^(e-2) * (1 + p + p^2), for e>1.
If n is powerful, a(n^k) = n^(k-1) * a(n).
For k>1, a(n^k) = n^(k-1) * a(n) * Prod_{p prime, ord(n,p)=1} (p^3-1) / (p^3-p).
mathematica: nn = 66; f[list_, i_] := list[[i]]; a = Table[If[Max[FactorInteger[n][[All, 2]]] < 3, 1, 0], {n, 1, nn}]; b =Table[n, {n, 1, nn}]; Table[
DirichletConvolve[f[a, n], f[b, n], n, m], {m, 1, nn}] (* _Geoffrey Critzer_, Feb 22 2015 *)
program: (PARI) a212793(n) = {my(f = factor(n)); for (i=1, #f~, if ((f[i, 2]) >=3, return(0)); ); return (1); }
a(n) = sumdiv(n, d, d*a212793(n/d)); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Feb 11 2015
(PARI) a(n) = sumdiv(n, d, if (ispower(d, 3), moebius(sqrtnint(d, 3))*sigma(n/d), 0)); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Mar 04 2015
results.author: _Álvar Ibeas_, Feb 11 2015
